website_summaries.verdict: These storage bags come with a double seal and allow you to pump directly into the bags.
pros: Label is easy to write on
Can freeze flat to save space
Easy to pour out without spills
cons: Some report leaks when bags are thawing

customer_reviews.title: Leaky bags...all of them.
customer_reviews.text: Beyond frustrated that the entire box of bags leaks. Breast milk spilled out all over my freezer. The package says new reinforced bags but they need to try much harder. The last package only had a few that leaked but this is ridiculous. I have to throw the whole box away.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have changed from older version, now leaks
customer_reviews.text: I used the Lansinoh storage bags exclusively when I pumped for my first child in 2015 and never had any problems with it leaking. Whether is was just holding fresh milk or defrosting milk that was frozen a day or months, they never leaked. When I had my second child last year 2018, I came back to Lansinoh when I started pumping for storage and noticed an immediate difference to how the bags felt (especially since I had some old ones left to compare). The plastic does feel ever slightly thinner which is fine as long as it does the job. Unfortunately, we have noticed constant leaking when defrosting milk on numerous occasions and will not longer purchase these.
customer_reviews.author: dinkkycow

customer_reviews.title: I like these bags overall
customer_reviews.text: I like these bags overall. We had an issue with a leak once after taking it out of the freezer but, as I said, that was only once. Also - one of the boxes contained bags where the serrations weren't working properly, causing me to rip the tops off of most of the bags accidentally. They were still useable and did the job, but it was quite frustrating and took away from some of the convenience while trying to pump at work. * also, I use these with my medella pump. I just cut little slits in the top of the bags to attach easily to the pump adaptor.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Schwindt

customer_reviews.title: Leaks- don't waste your time, milk or money
customer_reviews.text: The second bag I pulled to use started leaking as soon as my milk began pooling in the bag. Got out a third which leaked as well. My production isn't high enough to be able to afford the risk of any loss so I'm going to have to just throw away the rest. Even more unfortunately- I'd accidentally ordered 2 boxes of bags so I'm out twice as much.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Bags leak once thawed after freezing -AVOID
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend these bags! I have been expressing regularly for almost 6 months and only recently started to thaw, and use the milk I had stored in my freezer. You can only imagine how devastated I am to discover the bags leak once thawed. I worked so hard to express and store my breastmilk, wanting to save every drop of liquid gold, only to see milk wasted every time I thaw a bag.... and i cannot do anything about it. 6 months of stored milk in bags that leak. I estimate I lose 5-10% of milk per bag! AVOID!!! Look at photo and video of bag leaking
customer_reviews.author: Jase NV

customer_reviews.title: Bags are cracked after thawing 5 month old milk
customer_reviews.text: My baby was in NICU for 5 months so I pumped and froze a TON of milk. I had to purchase a small freezer just to store all of it. I was excited about these bags because of the space efficiency and being able to note the volume/date. But now my daughter is home and as I thaw bags, many are busted and my milk leaks out/water gets in. I didn't overfill them, they weren't freezer burned and I packed them neatly - no bends. so I just don't think that the bags are designed for long-term freezing. They're great for short-term.
customer_reviews.author: Maisha Husband

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a way to stop the leaking
customer_reviews.text: I love these bags. I keep reading reviews that talk about leaking. I have had a few bags leak on me but they happened to only be ones that I put straight from the freezer to the counter to thaw when I’m in a hurry. When I put them from the freezer to the refrigerator (like you’re supposed to), I have never had a leak. I hope this helps anyone who’s had problems.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted these to work
customer_reviews.text: I was told that these could stand up on their own and freeze flat, which were great selling points for me. This is a reputable brand & I really wanted to love another Lansinoh product but it was not to be. Almost every other bag has leaked when thawing. I’m lost soooo much milk to these faulty bags. Also, trying to get these to freeze completely flat is another joke - it takes all kinds of secret tricks & hacks to make them freeze without bulging at the bottom. Not impressed. Did not live up to my expectations at all.
customer_reviews.author: JaNaely

customer_reviews.title: So so disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used lansinoh bags before with my 1st child 3 years ago and had no problem so this time with my 2nd child I decided to use these bags again. However,little did I know how bad these have turned out to be! They are NOT leak proof at all. I store a stash in the freezer every day and unfortunately each bag that I have thawed has leaked! That's happened every single time loosing so much precious breastmilk! I took it out of the freezer to let it thaw in the refrigerator. A few hours later when I took the bag out I found it to be leaking! Very very disappointed. I've switched to Medela and hopefully that'll be better!
customer_reviews.author: Mariam Rash

customer_reviews.title: Worst bags ever!
customer_reviews.text: They work fine when freezing milk. Many of them broke while defrosting milk! At first I thought it was damage from being hit in the freezer so I started freezing them in a box by themselves. They still broke. I had to make sure I had them in a container to catch the defrosted milk in the fridge! And I couldn't run them under hot water or submerge in water to defrost faster! Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: jarod nelson

customer_reviews.title: Leaky bags!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. As a mom that is trying to provide breastmilk to her baby, it is very upsetting to see breastmilk being wasted. When I thawed my frozen breastmilk, it ended up all over the refrigerator. I had used other brands, ameda and kiinde and didn’t have any problems. I hope they enhance the design so it doesn’t leak. It is very difficult as is to provide breastmilk to my baby as a working mom, and we shouldn’t have to worry about the bags being defective.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Sze

customer_reviews.title: Trusting, easy to use, hard to leak, using it in second pregnancy!🍼
customer_reviews.text: I used this bags for my 1st pregnancy and I love them, I try mafelas, and other like target or store department and it was not the same, they break, leak and it was so frustrating loosing the golden liquid. I figure I was successful with Lansinoh after 1 month of trying different brands, so I stick to it until I end breath feeding. This is my second pregnancy and I already bought the bag because I trust them, they don't leak easy, break easy, and easy to use !
customer_reviews.author: CGCH

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy These!!!
customer_reviews.text: These worked great initially. No issues - they stand up themselves, seemed to be leak-proof, held a sufficient amount of milk. Months later, while defrosting the milk, the bags started leaking. I thought my husband was maybe trying to cram the bag into a cup of warm water or something. Nope. Almost half of the bags have leaked, I have wasted 2-3 full bags of breast milk because they leaked into the cup of warm water they were defrosting in, or they leaked out all over the diaper bag. I don’t ever write reviews, but I know how important stored milk is and I didn’t want anyone else to experience it!!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Greenawalt

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR PRECIOUS MILK!
customer_reviews.text: I was ecstatic when I received these bags and could use them with my medela pump. I was blessed with an abundance of breast milk and stored a large freezer full of milk to give to my baby girl later when I decided to wean her off of the breast. When it came time to thaw and use the milk, about 40% of my stored milk could not be used because they were compromised. The bags developed pinpoint holes that would leak milk when I would defrost them under warm running water. I was devastated and disappointed. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Jojo

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: They all leak! I would fill them and put it in the freezer immediately. I didn't notice any leaks.i never overfilled ...most bags were 3-4 oz. So far every bag I've taken out had leaked out while thawing. I lost 2 whole bags like this before realizing it was a flaw in all bags. Vry disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Mr F

customer_reviews.title: These bags LEAK when thawed!!
customer_reviews.text: These leak! I used to use these bags 7 years ago with my first child, and these were great, so I got them again for my second. But they must have changed the product! Half the time, these bags leak and my breastmilk is all over the place! I simply cannot use these. They leak when I thaw them (in warm water, or in the refrigerator for one day). Literally have only thawed maybe 10-12 bags and 5 or so have leaked. Returning!
customer_reviews.author: C. PinchonTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Save your milk, buy Madela
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second box of 100 bags. The first box had zero issues, and that's great but it's not enough to compensate for the fact that the second box has had equal amounts of leaking and non-leaking bags when defrosting. It's beyond upsetting to see my milk (that I've worked SO HARD for) leaking away. I might as well be dumping milk down the drain with these things. Yes, I can put them inside a ziplock or other container, but the point is, I shouldn't have to. I was very happy with the first box I bought but now I feel betrayed, personally attacked, and over dramatic but 100% serious. I won't ever buy these bags again.
customer_reviews.author: Elsa Rashad

customer_reviews.title: Space saver
customer_reviews.text: I switch between brands but the lansinoh bags are the easiest to store. The bags do feel thinner but they don't take up as much room as like Medela or Kiinde bags. If you don't have much freezer space and on a budget then this would be the best one to choose from. I never had any leak issues but I make sure to keep it separate (like in a container and compartment) when freezing and thawing.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Thin but easy to pour
customer_reviews.text: I have a medela pump and used medela bags earlier. But I just wanted to try Lansinoh as it was more economical and all my friends use it. I must say the first impression was the bag qualty is thinner than medela bags - this made me nervous of leaks/tearing etc. But surprisingly never happened! I pump and transfer it into bags and seal it. I thaw it directly in the bottle warmer and worked perfectly! Also, easy to pour because of the shape unlike medela which has a flat opening which sometimes results in spilling. Happy with my purchase but still not sure of quality/thickness of the bags
customer_reviews.author: Avid Buyer

customer_reviews.title: TOP SEAL DOES NOT WORK. DON’T BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for the past 10 months and don’t have any problems until this recent order. I chose this product because it’s double seal function, but new ones that I received does not seal on the top. It looks like the alignment is off. It takes a lot of afford to push it into the alignment and even then, it’s not perfectly sealed. It brought 4 boxes and they are all the same. This one also has a stronger plastic smell which I don’t noticed with the old ones, makes me worried about putting my breast milk in it. Will be returning these and look for anther brand.
customer_reviews.author: Terence

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these if you are going to freeze at any point. I have a freezer full of milk that I am thawing and it does not matter how I am thawing them out, they leak every where. I have tried just letting them thaw naturally in the refrigerator and multiple bags have leaked all over the place! I have also tried in cold water and once again, all in the water. Don’t waste your money just because they are on the cheaper side.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Don’t trust the measurements marks
customer_reviews.text: Decent bags, inaccurate measurements. The bag claims to hold 6oz/180mls. It’s does not hold that much if following the user instructions. Instructions say you are not supposed to fill it beyond the 6oz mark which is really about 4.5oz. I wonder if this is why so many people are experiencing leaks from these bags because they are actually putting 6oz in it when it’s only supposed to hold about 4.5oz. Also If you put a real 6oz portion of milk in them, like I’ve been doing, they do not freeze flat. So your are better off using a lesser amount. Company needs to fix their labels for accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Lady.Bway

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE! Leak everywhere when thawing
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE! I should’ve known when I opened these and the plastic just felt different from the REAL lansinoh bags you get at the grocery store that these were bad news. The LEAK EVERYWHERE when thawing the bags. They freeze the milk good but thawing somehow magically causes holes everywhere. After loosing an entire bag of milk I decided to place on of the bags in a large ziplock baggie and thaw it that way so now excess water would get in the bag. Do yourself a favor and drive to the grocery store to get the real milk storage bags!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Barton

customer_reviews.title: A leaky disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Half the time when I took the bags of my frozen breast milk out of the freezer the bags leaked all over the place from the bottom when defrosting. If I put them in water to defrost, sometimes milk leaked out into the water. I ended up wasting so much of my hard earned pumped milk! They are not reliable at all. If you use these, make sure to defrost in a cup or bowl right away to avoid a mess but be careful if you put directly in water to defrost. I am never getting these again! Other brands I used never did this!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Bunze

customer_reviews.title: Good but had a few leaks
customer_reviews.text: I don't have too many complaints about these bags because they were almost perfect. However, after freezing some of my milk some of the bags leaked when they defrosted in the fridge. I have no idea what happened because they didn't leak prior to being frozen so good thing I defrosted them in a container in the fridge or milk would have gone everywhere. I stopped purchasing these and use the target brand now (5 months) and I've never had a leak with the target ones.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for storage, not accurate at measuring amounts
customer_reviews.text: Great breast milk storage bags. They have an easily removable tab that ensures the opening of the bag stays clean and free of debris. I love this feature because it’s easy to put a few in your pumping bag and not worry about them. I even have one in my purse as backup. I use the Freemie pump and it’s easy to pour milk into the bag after pumping. The measurements on the bag are more of a guess. There were multiple times when I thought it was a 4 oz bag but it was three and my husband had to get another bag. That’s the only negative I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Anne

customer_reviews.title: Great storage bags
customer_reviews.text: I got these on sale and am thankful for that as I use a ton of them! I have had a few leak so I always thaw in a clean container to catch any leaks. Overall a great product and my favorite bags to use
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Have not disappointed yet and still love them regardless of new style.
customer_reviews.text: So far we haven’t had any leak which I was worried after reading reviews but we only filled the bags 2-4 oz. I have been freezing 4-6 oz now so I’m hoping this stays true because I’d cry if we lost that much milk thawing it in water. Used these with the old version with my now 4 year old and hoping they don’t disappoint which it’s now been almost 5 months and I have about 3 months worth of supply saved up in the freezer in these bags. I get as much air out as possible and freeze flat.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Larson

customer_reviews.title: Best for BM storage
customer_reviews.text: Great for storing milk in the fridge and freezer. They're durable so they won't break and waste all your precious BM. They're also wide enough on top to pour your milk in if you're pumping into a bottle and pouring it in afterwards. They also make it so that you can pump directly into the bags now. I've also tried the Dr. Brown bags and the medela bag. These got them beat. Amazon sells these for the best price compared to Walmart or target.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Phan

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: When used correctly (squeeze out air, don’t overfill, lay flat to freeze solid) they work quite well. There is a high chance of user error if the mom doesn’t pay attention and look at how to do it before using. That said, it is fairly easy once you know/have the hang of it. I like that I can thaw (and warm milk) quickly in a cup of warm water and then pour warmed milk into a bottle. Skips a step, doesn’t require a fancy machine to do it and is quick when the milk was frozen flat. Note: IF DEFROSTING OVERNIGHT IN THE FRIDGE,DO IT IN A CONTAINER IN CASE OF LEAKS IN BAG (it can happen)
customer_reviews.author: Hana

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience: seams rip!!! Lost milk.
customer_reviews.text: This is long overdue. I’ve used these bags lots and lots over the course of 2.5 years, 2 babies and have been tremendously frustrated with how they rip. Everything is fine filling them with breast milk and freezing them. But somehow when thawing to prepare for my baby about half of them end up ripped, resulting in the melting milk to be wasted as it pours out of the seams of the bag. I cannot count how much wasted breast milk I’ve lost because of this. As all pumping mothers know, milk is precious and it angers me so that the name brand bags I carefully stored my milk in are damaged.
customer_reviews.author: L. Queen

customer_reviews.title: My favorite breast milk bags**updated!***
customer_reviews.text: These are good bags, durable, sturdy, easy to use and store in the freezer. Ive ordered other bags and I always seem to come back to these ones. Ive never had one leak and ive gone through 200. ***Update*** Over the last 3 weeks Ive had a few of these bags leak during the thawing process. Anyone who pumps breast milk knows how frustrating this can be, so I'm lowering my 5 stars to 3 stars because these bags should be made NEVER EVER TO LEAK!! Since my deep freezer is about a quarter filled up with pumped breast milk, only time will tell how many other defective bags and leaks I will come across! So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: NCP

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate measurements but good for price
customer_reviews.text: The bag says do not fill past 6oz line but whenever we had 4-5 oz to the bag, it goes way past the line. The bags are not accurate for measurement; you’re better off measuring from a bottle and then pouring it in. Bags are cheap and pretty durable. We started to freeze my stash so haven’t heated up the frozen milk yet though we plan to thaw versus heating in water. Not enough room to write the important info to track milk stats. Overall, bags are great and useful. Haven’t had issues with them breaking. Knock on wood!
customer_reviews.author: STS 1

customer_reviews.title: They leak!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for a couple of months now and they work fine if you storage in the fridge but if you freeze them they leak when you thaw them out. It’s happened three times now I’m loosing a lot of milk I had stashed for when i went back to work. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Bags leak after thawed. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Not a great purchase. These bags seemed fine when we were filling them and held up great in the freezer but once thawed out...NOT GOOD. They leak! We’ve lost quite a bit of milk due to this. I do not reccomend be cautious.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit spectra anymore!
customer_reviews.text: I got some bags from a friend that was done breastfeeding and was delighted to find out you can pump directly into the bags. Such a time saver! I bought my own box of 100 and the bag I was using just fell off the flange. I thought it was a fluke but sure enough, the bags are definitely bigger. I bought another box of 50 that came with adaptors but apparently it's only for models, etc. There's a universal one but it looks like a pain to wash. Otherwise the bags are nice, just wish I could pump into the bags again!
customer_reviews.author: Soo J Mcbride

customer_reviews.title: Great milk storage solution!
customer_reviews.text: These were my go to bags when I started building my freezer milk supply. They are thick enough that I feel confident in it as a storage option but not too thick as to make defrosting it a pain. Each bag comes with a tear away seal to ensure everything is sterile. Lansinoh also has an adapter that enables you to pump straight into the bag - unlike medela you don't need to buy specific bags for that which makes it even easier. Each pack of 50 comes in its own resealable plastic bag which makes transporting these super convenient.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great bags, and leak proof.
customer_reviews.text: I like these bags! I got hooked on them while using sample bags from a baby registry bag. Ended up buying this box since I love them so much. No issues with leaking at all. Easy to label and store. Freeze flat and store together to save space. Do not trust the ounce markings though; trust what your bottle for your pump says. Bags leave room for error if not sitting just right.
customer_reviews.author: Detronyx

customer_reviews.title: Wasted almost as much milk as they held...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if the bags I got were marred during production or what, but for some reason, I would say at least 50% of the bags had holes in them and leaked quite a bit of my breastmilk out of them. Its to the point that I can't even pump with them because they even leak everywhere as I'm pumping. I know it's not user error because I've used this product before with no issues, but to say that I am EXTREMELY disappointed with my experience this time around would be an understatement. I had to work very hard to get my supply up in the first place, and to have so much of it wasted is extremely frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No leaks
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been using these for the past 8 months and has almost 2000 ounces stored in the deep freezer. She likes these more than other bags shes used. Pros: good price, easy to use, seal well, no leaks when thawing, easy to store Cons: my wife used to pump directly into them from her Lansinoh pump, but when a 5 oz bag fell off onto the floor, she never trusted them to stay attached after that. Could have been user error, but haven't tested it since.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after frozen
customer_reviews.text: I loved these bags when pumping. They held the most milk and froze flat the best out of the two or three brands I used in 6 months. I stopped breastfeeding over a month ago and have been relying on 150+ bags of frozen milk to supplement my sons daily feeding with breast milk. In 1 1/2 months I’ve had four bags break while thawing in the fridge. These left me with a mess on the shelf, other food was covered in breast milk, and the loss of the invaluable milk itself. The first time I thought it was a fluke, but 4 bags later, I will make sure to never use this brand with my next child.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Feeney

customer_reviews.title: Tear top is poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the way the tear open top works. Because it tears with pieces being removed from either side of the top instead of a tear straight across, the opening to pour milk into is oddly shaped and requires you to be very precise to avoid milk spilling down the edges of the bag. I had samples of this brand of bag that we luckily used before opening the box we bought so I will be returning these. I liked the Advent brand much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Well made - no leaks!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are pretty good, but not perfect. They don't leak, which is obviously the most important thing. My main complaint is that it is hard to pour the milk out without spilling. The extra plastic at the top is flimsy and the milk sometimes spills, even when I'm trying to be careful. I've gotten around this a bit by cutting the bag open with scissors to create a straight edge to pour from, which helps a bit. Also, the numbers also are not very accurate so you need to measure the milk before pouring it into the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect storage and no leaking!!!
customer_reviews.text: These breast milk storage bags are the best for the FREEZER!! They store so well for the freezer only in my opinion if that is what you are thinking of buying them for then don’t hesitate. I do not think they are the best for the fridge because they aren’t sturdy standing on their own. For fridge storage I recommend the Medela ones but since I store in the freezer more often than fridge I love these. I also have never had a problem with leaving and thawing out is super easy
customer_reviews.author: Ruru

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I am soooooo upset!!!! I purchased these bags twice. The first 100 I froze my milk in. Later, I decided to start defrosting so my husband and son could help feed my baby. To my surprise the bags have holes in them. As they defrosted my milk leaked all over the counters. First I thought it was a mistake I made. Then I realized ALL my bags were leaking. So pissed off.
customer_reviews.author: M.Sades

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Milk Storage Bags
customer_reviews.text: The Lansinoh bags are my favorite brand out of the four that I've tried recently. Pros: Seals easily, easy to squeeze the excess air out before sealing, takes up minimal space in the refrigerator or freezer, stays sealed when shaken to mix the layers of milk Cons: A few bags have leaked from the corner while pouring or leaked from the bottom when thawing after freezing. Not a consistent issue, but annoying when it happens.
customer_reviews.author: NJMom

customer_reviews.title: Best milk bags for freezing
customer_reviews.text: These are the best bags for freezing milk flat. Just fill with 5oz of milk and lay flat to freeze. Then once solid you can stack in your freezer easily. I like to use a bread pan to stack them when I am trying to get them to freeze. I have tried other brands but this is the best!
customer_reviews.author: WVmtnmomma

customer_reviews.title: Secure seal, easy to use and store milk.
customer_reviews.text: Quality bags that feel more durable than most milk storage bags. The double zip lock is great for preventing leaks or when storing in the fridge or freezer. Easy to label, and easy to pour into bottles without spilling. Can store any milk or liquid in these really! Human milk, animal milk like cows and goats ( not ducks though.... ducks don’t lactate). I will order more of these bags until my wife runs dry.
customer_reviews.author: lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as the Medela bags, but they work just as well. I used to use Medela but stopped because of the extra layer of PET, which, yes, makes them more sturdy, but is an extra layer of chemicals that I can do without. I mean, food grade plastic is still plastic and contains chemicals of some sort (even if they are deemed safe). I went with Lansinoh because they have just a tiny bit less chemical content.
customer_reviews.author: O Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Can store good amount of milk
customer_reviews.text: Got the lansinoh bag to use while pumping and it can fit a lot of milk in the bag. The only thing is sometimes the milk gets too heavy and the bag falls off. Also, have to make sure the ziplock part is closed tightly. My milk leaked in the bag I was bringing home from work even though I pressed on it tightly to make sure that it was sealed. But, this brand is better than the other ones I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: hoi yu

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried various other breastmilk storage bags and these are my favorites. I really like the feel of there bags they aren’t too stiff and are durable. The only issues I’ve encounter with these bags are if you drop them and they fall just righty on the corner it creates a hole. This is probably due to the 90 degree corner creating a sharp point while other bags have rounded ends.
customer_reviews.author: Branden Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great bags
customer_reviews.text: I used these for my entire first pregnancy and never had issues with spilling or the bags ripping once Frozen then thawed. Would highly recommend. My insurance this house round provides a different brand for free or else I would still use these.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie W. Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: Leaky
customer_reviews.text: I have brought about 200 of these bags now. They have been great but lately I am starting experience leakly bags when I take the bags out of the freezer to thaw. Very inconsistent quality across different boxes of this very same brand. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Rose H.

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap bags which is the only reason why I use them. They are horrible. They are flimsy and can’t stand on their own. When trying to hold a bottle with one hand and pour milk with another, they will spill milk all over the place. Some have broke in the freezer but not enough to make a fuss about. I prefer the Kinde bags. I also tried the Nanobe bags (weird bag shape) and another popular brand, but the plastic seemed sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite storage bags
customer_reviews.text: I think these bags are great. I have used them for both my boys now. They lay flat to freeze which makes storage super easy. I have had a few leak but I'm pretty sure that has been my fault for leaving air in the bag then squeezing where the air bubble was too hard and puncturing the bag. I have bought these over and over and will continue to do so. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Heather CTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Bags Leak
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought these bags were great upon initial use. I Like the curved cut outs on side to easily transfer milk from the bag to bottle or vice versa. After using them to freeze and store milk I found that they leak during the unthawing process. When it happed once I thought maybe it was just a faulty bag, but it has now happened more often.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t hold up as well as I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Finally defrosting my breast milk that I’ve had stored for a bit and at first I really loved the convenience of these bags but so many I’ve started defrosting ended up leaking :( liquid gold in the trash. Makes me so sad, hard work pumping and it’s wasted by a stupid bag not holding up. I haven’t tried any other brands, but I’ve used over 200 plus bags from this company. Try to find a brand that holds up better if you could, I know you’ll probably pay more but it’s worth it if you don’t have to throw away any of your liquid gold! Good luck out their mamas!
customer_reviews.author: alena

customer_reviews.title: They do leak
customer_reviews.text: these are great for the price. Easy to use BUT they leak. When defrosting they leak about 50% on the time. So definitely have to defeost sitting in a bowl or other container rather than with/in water.
customer_reviews.author: Jada

customer_reviews.title: My favorite bag
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few different breastmilk storage bags, and these are by far my favorite. They're much thinner than the Medela ones, so they lay flatter in the freezer so you can stack them better. It also takes no time to thaw and warm milk for bottles in these, much easier than in bottles! You actually have to be careful not to let the milk get too warm! In the past 7 months I've frozen over a thousand ounces of milk and never had a leak. At work I use one set of bottles to pump into, then pour into these bags and put the used bottles in the fridge for the next pumping session.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D Eisenman

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I used these without any problem with my first born 5 years ago. So when I had to exclusively pump with my new nugget I came right back to this product and I’m so disappointed!!! The bags leak from the corners where they crimped together when pouring in fresh milk or they leak when they defrost. I have a bag leak almost everyday and all I do is defrost them in a bowl on the counter. The picture is of 5oz lost this morning 😡 I’m not sure what they did to their product but I will now pay more for the better quality Medela bags.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Miyamura

customer_reviews.title: Not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The measurement on these is absolutely terrible. They might as well not be marked at all; recommend measuring with a bottle and pouring it in. Also, do not try to stand these up on their own! The bottom of them flares out so that they can stand, but be warned, they definitely cannot! Otherwise, they seem ok. They store my breastmilk and have yet to leak. I much preferred storing in bottles but I was using up way too many bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great for freezing and laying on side!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these in the past for my previous pregnancy. They are great, I just don't recommend over filling them then freezing them. Also they do tend to leak sometimes after freezing and then during the defrosting process. I'm not sure how or why. They definitely store nicely on their side when in the freezer. I was a heavy producer so a couple bags leaking wasn't the end of the world for me, the storability is really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Heaven

customer_reviews.title: leaks after freezing
customer_reviews.text: pros: cheap, easy to use, fills easily, pours easily cons: leaks in quite a few of them after freezing. really annoying when these things leak all over your fridge or counter when thawing milk. we now have to thaw them in a bowl so they don't leak everywhere. however we figured this out after filling basically 75 of these since we were not using the breastmilk at the time. probably about a 50% leakage rate. i would try the medela ones next time.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s meant to do but too much unnecessary work
customer_reviews.text: I usually use Medela bags but decided to try Lansinoh since I prefer their nipple cream over Medela. Once these bags are done I will be going back to Medela bags because they are just easier to use. These do what they are meant to do but has an unnecessary time consuming opening process. There is like this plastic that you rip off on the outside of a sealed top plastic area that you write on which you then have to unseal to get to the ziplock sealed inner lining before opening that to pour the milk in. Time is everything when you pump at work
customer_reviews.author: Jamaica

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Leaks. Go for Medela even if $$
customer_reviews.text: Now I know why Medela costs more. These new and improved bags are still nowhere close to Medela quality. The side seal looks imperfect. The ziplock can break easily. I’m terrified that it may rip or leak. Might not even use. UPDATED: ...and my worse fear just came true. More than half the bags are leaking as I thaw them. I’m left to collect all that ‘sterile’ milk in a bowl, hoping to catch any drips from these broken bags. Spend more. Suck up the inconvenience of not being able to store flat and just get medela bags. These are absolutely horrendous.
customer_reviews.author: Witchkraft

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok but don’t trust that measuring
customer_reviews.text: I’m using these with Spectra breast pump. And it works like supposed to. But when I needed to use my frozen milk first time, I noticed that it’s a difference between actual volume in bottle and what bag shows. It’s disappointing - almost 1/3 less! Why they are making that measuring marks if it’s not working? So if you wanna know how much do you have, you should pump in bottles, measure and then transfer into a bag. I bought adapters for pumping directly into bags, but this method makes them useless and gives me extra work((
customer_reviews.author: Daria

customer_reviews.title: Very good at freezing
customer_reviews.text: Very good at freezing. Of the ~200 we have used, 2 have leaked during defrosting. We defrost in a cup though so no milk has been wasted. Can be a little complicated to get the milk back out though, esp if the baby is crying and its kind of dark in the room. Overall though they've been very handy and a great way to store breastmilk!
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Leaky bags
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I wanted to like these more. I had issues with the bags leaking. I ended up switching to a store brand and had zero issues with leaking bags. Sorry Lansinoh... You need to do better.
customer_reviews.author: unicornpuke528

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: I breastfed for my daughter's first year. I am a working mom so I was pumping majority of the time. I've tried a few other brands of storage bags but I found that these are the most practical. I used the Lansinoh pump as well so being able to pump right into the bag was a plus. We had a few that busted when warming which broke my heart (EBF moms you know what I mean, LIQUID GOLD) which is why I took away a star. But overall, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Laura P.

customer_reviews.title: Leaky bags!
customer_reviews.text: I used these bags 2 years ago and they were great. I don't know what happened with the new design but I'm running into issues with leakage. I can't even explain how frustrating it is to lose milk because half the bag leaked in the fridge. I bought a bunch of these bags so now I'm adding a small sandwich bag under so I can find it a bag is leaking. I'm hoping to find a better storage bag in the meantime.
customer_reviews.author: Maritess G. Pajarillo

customer_reviews.title: Best out there
customer_reviews.text: After 3 babies and a lot of freezing mike - these were by far the best. We used everything - Nuk, Honeysuckle, you name it. These were the best bags to use when it comes to freezing, storing/stacking, and thawing without bursting. Recommend freezing by laying flat and thaw in the fridge overnight for best results. Take it from a dad who is very type A and did all of the breastmilk storage activities for all our babies. We have bought well over 1,000 total of these bags.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done!
customer_reviews.text: These are my preferred storage bags. They're easy to use and the ziploc is amazing. I've never had a spill, and I'm not the most careful! I typically pump into Medela bottles and pour the bottles into the bags. I've never had an issue with the bags splitting open when freezing as some others have. I've even filled past the 6 oz mark.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Templeton

customer_reviews.title: Leakage issues
customer_reviews.text: Had issues with leakage after putting in freezer. Lots couple bags of valuable milk this way
customer_reviews.author: IBerez

customer_reviews.title: Very useful - just not for measuring
customer_reviews.text: These bags have been very useful in storing the extra breastmilk that I have built up. My only actual complaint is that the measurement lines seem off. I pump into Spectra bottles and then transfer to these bags so I can freeze smaller amounts, and the amounts never match up. I think if you have the bottom of the bag unfolded to stand up then it's pretty close (still off somewhat though), but if you fold it in as if you are laying the bag flat then it's very off.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Great value with little leaks
customer_reviews.text: These are our favorite breastmilk bags. I know other people have talked about leaks, but in probably 400 bags, I have had a total of two bags where the zipper, or closure at the top, did not want to correctly work. And I’ve had to transfer milk into another bag. I have only seen leaks in these bags if they were dropped or mishandled while frozen!
customer_reviews.author: BRye

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality bag
customer_reviews.text: Three stars because you get so many for the price but the quality of these bags is awful. They are so thin and do not stand up in the refrigerator. The measurements from my bottle always appear differently in the bag. When you try to pour the milk out of the bag it’s so flemsy that you will spill milk. Other brands are a little more expensive but the quality of the bag is much better and worth the extra money so you don’t spill your hard earned milk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Measurements are off
customer_reviews.text: Bags work fine and are easy to use. I haven’t froze any milk so I’m not sure if they leak when defrosting or not. The only issue I have is the accuracy of the measurements. On the bag I can have 4 oz and when I pour into a bottle I only get 2.5-3oz which is a little frustrating when you don’t produce a lot of milk.
customer_reviews.author: DIE.ANN

customer_reviews.title: Best bags
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been ordering these for 6 months and each pack I get the consistency seems different. Some are super flimsy, some are very hard to open and the plastic seems thick, but they all do their job. I’ve only had one bag leak and I think we heated it too much. Recommend! Better than the medela ones because they hold more and kay flat when you freeze them.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Strobel

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and fulfills the purpose
customer_reviews.text: This is 2nd time im buying these bags. They are quite cheaper, can get flat by using 2 cookie sheets to flat the bag in freezer and dont leak at all. The only thing is that its little hard to pour it back to the bottle for the feeding time But that is common issue with almost all storage bags. The Quality of the lansinoh bags is not as thickness as Spectra but it does the job of storing milk and not leaking. That’s more important for me as I dont want to lose the milk by having to leak it from the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ritenkumar Patel

customer_reviews.title: Leakage
customer_reviews.text: Once I thaw my milk the bags tend to leak and that's not good. I've used 100s of bags and months down the road here I am having leaking bags. I read other reviews mentioning this happening but I went with them anyways because I like the brand and I don't like the fact the bag either takes on water or drains liquid gold. Fix this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenience when pumping and storing for later
customer_reviews.text: I transfer from a bottle after pumping into these bags and freeze them for later use. Seal well, freeze well, but not the easiest to pour milk from bottle into this bag. Would probably be best to get the attachment so you can pump directly into the bag. Otherwise excellent product that adds convenience when pumping.
customer_reviews.author: cke

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Bags
customer_reviews.text: I have used these bags for 3-4 months of breast feeding but my most recent order has been a nightmare...I lost two 6 oz bags of milk because the bags were defective and the corners were coming open and leaking. After the first two bags, I continued to monitor for leaking. I have now had 6-7 bags that have leaked. Luckily, after the first few times, I caught it and have been able to transfer the other milk to different bags. So frustrating as a nursing mom to lose breast milk!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Durable bags
customer_reviews.text: I have used a few different bags and these are the best. They close securely without leaking and are easy to write on with a pen. I haven’t had any issues with them ripping or cracking in the freezer. I have used the Medela bags before and they leak and break in the freezer which is so disappointing after all the hard work of pumping. Breast milk is liquid gold and every ounce is precious. Very pleased with these bags.
customer_reviews.author: J&A Feight

customer_reviews.title: Label by day and total oz. store flat.
customer_reviews.text: Use these everyday to decant expressed milk. I have over 200 stored in my freezer. They are leakproof so long as close the bags properly which is easy task, and I hold up to 7 oz no problem. If I know I’m going to add to the bag before freezing I do not put in fridge right away, just a little tip so you do not ruin nutritional value of precious milk!
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: They leaked
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in the quality of these. Almost every bag leaked and after working so hard to pump it was awful...let’s just say I did cry over spilt milk.
customer_reviews.author: angie

customer_reviews.title: Alright product.
customer_reviews.text: This product is alright. It stores fine but it is too flimsy. It's hard to get the air out. It leaks milk from the top when getting the air out of the bag to seal. Also purchased an adapter to pump directly into the bag which works okay too but its super inconvenient. I have the Spectra S2. I spend a little extra money on Kiinde branded twist cap bags and that comes with an adapter that actually fits perfectly to the pump. Kiinde is a little more pricey but with all the previous hassles I've had with these breastmilk bags it's worth the extra money!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Reed

customer_reviews.title: Ounces are off
customer_reviews.text: The ounces on these bags are way off. I measured 3oz in a glass meauring cup, poured it into an avent bottle to be sure they lined up, then poured it into a lansinoh bag. The bag read a little over 5 oz. Other than that, I dont see any real problems with these bags. Theyre easy to use, haven't leaked, and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: K&J

customer_reviews.title: Will do.... but won’t buy from amazon again.
customer_reviews.text: For its price, it is good. These were the cheapest ones I could find on Amazon. However, I would not recommend using the bags in place of the bottles on the pump. The pump will not work the same. The bottles provide more suction. Also, what I really didn’t like is the box came in terrible condition. It looked like it had been tampered with and thrown around a few times. Next time, I will just buy at target because I know it will be in clean, crisp condition. The bags themselves were not damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Melbeuf

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality. Lost milk.
customer_reviews.text: For eight months I’ve bought this brand bags, however they haven’t been from this seller but I took a chance because they were cheaper. What happened? They were horrible quality. I could tell from the moment I tried to use one that the material was much thinner than what I’m use to, and the zipper is so fused together I nearly rip the bag every time opening it. I told myself to bare with it but now I’m getting leaks. Just lost two ounces of milk inside my pump bag because of a hole under zipper. Not worth it. I barely produce enough so losing those ounces was heartbreaking. Going to attempt to return what bags I have left.
customer_reviews.author: Kira Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Really good for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are really good for the price. They have a double zipper seal and a flange-shaped top, which makes it easy to pour milk into bottles. I freeze them flat and then upright to store. I've had occasional leaks from the bags, and have gotten into habit of thawing milk in a large cup/small pitcher so any leaked milk can be saved. I've bought a lot of these by now!
customer_reviews.author: Julianna

customer_reviews.title: Completely seals and storage saving
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I've got them everywhere: the living room, diaper bag, kitchen... They seal completely so there's no spillage, they heat well in boiling hot water without melting, they're small enough to keep space in my fridge. The only complaint I have is the design of the top the bag. It's an odd shape and I find that makes it difficult to pour my pumped milk into the bag. I've lost an ounce or so of milk just trying to pour it in the bag, which makes night time savings a little difficult. My recommendation is to pour your milk in very carefully so you don't lose any! But otherwise, this is a really great product.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Bodnar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for refrigerating or freezing milk
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about suction power because I haven't been able to figure out how to use these directly with my breast pump and I don't use Lansinoh bottles. However, they work great for storing breastmilk. Fairly easy to pour milk into the bags, very easy to pour milk out into a bottle without making a mess. The measurement lines on the bags are very accurate and the bag stands when full to make it easy to see how much is there. It's easy to squeeze out air before refrigerating or freezing and bags are thick enough to prevent holes and leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Carrie McGee

customer_reviews.title: It’s defective or their quality has changed for the worst.
customer_reviews.text: My first baby two years ago I only used these bags. One issue that presented itself was that occasionally when I defrosted a bag it would leak. (No big problem because it didn’t happen often) Now I’m using this brand again on my second child. I don’t know if I got a defective product or their quality has gone down. Every other bag that I use had to be thrown out due to the fact that the bag has a hole at the top corner. I have gone through 25 bags already in 5 days because of throwing out the defective bags due to leaking. Unfortunately I am sending this product back due to this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mai

customer_reviews.title: Nice and cheap to get the job done
customer_reviews.text: Use these all the time. Love how cheap they are. The only thing is to pour from a pump bottle into these requires some steady hands, and sometimes from this bag back to bottle after being frozen is tricky... but they've never leaked, or punctured, and they stand upright pretty well and the price is right so I can't complain about that part.
customer_reviews.author: ThankGodforFreeShipping

customer_reviews.title: not a great buy
customer_reviews.text: These bags somehow opened by themselves when thawing or the ice would puncture the bag. Too many times I opened the fridge to see breast milk all over. Also, when pouring into the bottle a lot can spill if you are not extra careful because of the way the opening is. I would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall favourite bags
customer_reviews.text: These fit with my spectra 2, so I love being able to pump directly into the bags. I've only had two, so far, out of maybe 50 that I have thawed leak... I think it was probably how I stored them. Not as thick as medela ones, and that is my only dislike but they are way easy to store and less bulky because of that.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Campeau

customer_reviews.title: Freeze the bags laying down
customer_reviews.text: These bags have worked great. Out of the 100 we have used so far 1 had a hole in it. A quick tip freeze the bags laying down. It makes it way easier to store the milk. Some times the bag where you pour out the milk has tiny pieces of plastic that didn't get cut off when they were trimming the bags so the milk doesn't pour straight out.
customer_reviews.author: K and J Isaacson

customer_reviews.title: Good but beware of leaks
customer_reviews.text: Great storage for my breast milk. Mostly use these to pump and freeze to build a supply when I return to work. So far so good except I did have one bag leak while warming it up. I was so heartbroken and was afraid the water seeped through a hole in the bag while it was sitting in the water so I had to dump the bag and all it’s contents. :(. I’ve used about 50 bags thus far and only one didn’t hold up. These bags say you can pump directly into them but I don’t have the adapter and prefer to pump into a bottle and pour it into the bags so I can distribute an even amount.
customer_reviews.author: Aaliyah

customer_reviews.title: Eh...
customer_reviews.text: On a whole these bags are fine. Out of the over 200 I've used, I've had minimal issues. But have had about 5 bags leak milk and a batch of probably 25 that leak milk out the seal when you go to pour it into the bottle. I had to start using my breast pump flange as a tunnel to catch the milk from the seal and the open end. That's 0robably best practice anyway. What bothers me most is the leaky bags, when it gets all over my fridge and the food in my fridge and also leaves me short the milk I needed thawed for the day.
customer_reviews.author: Lee K.

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for 6 months now, daily. They go in the fridge, and then the freezer once I get home, for about 2 months on average. They are handled alot before and after freeze and they are holding up quite well. I have only had an issue with a handful of leaking bags while defrosting, and that was most likely because i probably dropped it while still frozen.
customer_reviews.author: KDR

product_meta.title: Lansinoh Breastmilk Storage Bags, 100 count
product_meta.description: Style:Storage BagsQuality you can trust. Lansinoh makes breastfeeding easier with their breastmilk storage bags that can be easily stored or frozen for later use. Pre-sterilized bags allow for direct pumping into the bag using a Lansinoh pump, and have a patented double zipper seal to prevent spills and leakages. Besides being the strongest milk storage bags with reinforced side seals, Lansinoh storage bags lay flat or stand upright for a more efficient space storage. A convenient pour spout at the top of the bag offers easier milk transfer into baby bottles. IMPORTANT! Ensure your Lansinoh Breastmilk Storage Bags have white and purple flowers and a white line above the logo. If your bags do not have this design, it is not compatible with pumping directly into the bag.
feature_bullets: Ideal breast milk storage: Our breastmilk storage bags are ideal for storing, freezing and protecting precious breastmilk. They come pre-sterilized with a double zipper seal to prevent leakage.

#1 selling & super strong: Lansinoh's #1 selling breastmilk storage bags are built super strong, with a double zipper seal to prevent leakage and reinforced double sealed side seams for ultimate protection.
Secure & safe: Presterilized for safe storage plus BPA and BPS free. Designed to lay flat for fast freezing and thawing to protect precious breast milk vitamins and nutrients.

Save time & pump directly into bag: Pump directly into Lansinoh breastmilk storage bags for convenience and reduced waste. Stand or lay flat for compact storage. Easy to use with write-on label and convenient pour spout.

Mom founded & parent led: Founded by a breastfeeding mom, Lansinoh has supported moms for 35 years with award winning breast pumps, nipple creams, nursing pads, and breast milk storage bags, helping families create bonds that last a lifetime.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars19,428 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
